<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;word-break: keep-all; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center; text-transform: uppercase; font-family: Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 16px; line-height: 18px; color: #353535; padding: 0px; margin: 0px;">

<td style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;vertical-align: bottom" valign="bottom" width="33%">

<td style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;vertical-align: top" valign="top">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: separate" width="100%">
<tr>
<td class="editors_note" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding: 0px 40px 16px 40px; border-left: 2px solid #353535; border-right: 2px solid #353535; border-bottom: 2px solid #353535; border-collapse: collapse; border-radius: 0px 0px 10px 10px;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Good morning. </strong>Sifting through the replies to yesterday’s newsletter, it became clear that one link in particular resonated with readers: The Atlantic’s <a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24674830.0/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cudGhlYXRsYW50aWMuY29tL2ZhbWlseS9hcmNoaXZlLzIwMjEvMDgvd2h5LXdlLXNob3VsZC10YWxrLXN0cmFuZ2Vycy1tb3JlLzYxOTY0Mi8_dXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXc/5f10d6a212c71038741b0759B14e99099?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">article</a> about the benefits of talking with strangers. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">What is it about talking to strangers that intrigues us? Probably because we know it enriches our lives but we can’t bring ourselves to do it.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">If you’re like me, you often freeze when given the opportunity to say hello to your neighbor on a plane. “What if they don’t want to talk to me?” we think. Even worse, what if they <em>do</em> want to talk to me? Not trying to hear about their stamp collection for three hours. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">These concerns are largely imaginary, and even detrimental. Studies show that chatting with strangers can boost happiness, improve mental health, and make you feel more connected to your community. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">So, in the spirit of trying something new, I’m suggesting that we all attempt to talk to one stranger today. Then reply and let me know about your experience. Who knows? Maybe you'll meet another Brew reader.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;font-family:flood-std, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-weight:500">—Neal Freyman</p>
</div>

</tr>

<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Icebreakers with...Erika Thompson of Texas Beeworks
</h1>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/06/icebreakers-witherika-thompson-texas-beeworks?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Erika Thomspon of Texas Beeworks holds up a comb on honeybees" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MTA5L2VyaWthX3Rob21wc29uLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em>Amanda Jewell Saunders</em>
</small>
</p>
</a>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">If there are two constants in Erika Thompson’s life, they are: Texas and bees. She started <a href="https://texasbeeworks.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Texas Beeworks</a> in 2014, became a full-time beekeeper in 2019, and signs all her emails with “Bee Well.” But she’s most famous for documenting her calm bee removal services on <a href="https://www.tiktok.com/@texasbeeworks?lang=en" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">TikTok</a>.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">After strapping into a bee suit, we asked Thompson a few Icebreakers—but please, don’t try this at home.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>You have 9 million followers on TikTok and huge followings on other social platforms. How do you balance creating content with actually being a beekeeper?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I always say creatures before content. I'm so thankful for the ability to show people the important and incredible work that bees and beekeepers do every day. But it can be a challenge. I think a lot of people don't realize that, first and foremost, I'm a beekeeper. And then after many, many other things, I'm putting together social content. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What was the moment when you decided to take beekeeping from a hobby to a career?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">About two years ago, I was trying to convince myself and everyone around me that I could leave my good office job and be a full-time beekeeper.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Then, one day I was sitting at work, at my office job, and I opened my email and saw a note from <em>Jeopardy!</em> They were asking me to help create a clue category about bees. And that’s when I thought, “They could have asked anyone.”</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What </strong><strong><em>Jeopardy!</em></strong><strong> category could you win that isn’t bee-related?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Oh my gosh. [Asks husband off call] What do I know a lot about, non-bee related? [Husband responds, “Texas.”]</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What word would best describe you in high school?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Dork. I was in orchestra, I was the captain of my high school bowling team, and I loved <em>Star Wars</em>. Our school even called the kids in orchestra “Orch Dorks.”</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>This interview has been lightly edited and condensed for clarity.</em></p>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse" width="100%">
<tr>
<td style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px">
<a rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none" target="_blank" href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F08%2F06%2Ficebreakers-witherika-thompson-texas-beeworks" class=""><img style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k5/3/p/605cd938b510b.png">

</h1>

<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Can we ask you a ~personal~ question? Do you have money or a credit card or a 401(k) or an investment account or student loans or a mortgage or a kid who may want to, ugh, backpack around Europe “for a little while?”</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Then gosh darn it do we have great news for you. We’re launching our new personal finance newsletter called <strong>Money Scoop</strong> and you should <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/money-scoop/subscribe?utm_medium=crosspromo&utm_source=morning_brew&utm_campaign=daily_moneyscoop_crosspromo_08082021" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sign up</a>.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">It’s written by an honest-to-goodness CPA (but, like, the cool kind) and twice weekly he will be discussing all the financial topics you need to know.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">On that (bank) note <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/rZ4FAijU" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">we want to hear from you</a>! Tell us what you wish you knew about money, what you’re nervous about, or what you haven’t told anyone about your finances. We’ll use these “Money Secrets” to keep the content machine chuggin’ along.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">See you for Money Scoop’s first issue on <strong>August 17th</strong>, but only if you <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/money-scoop/subscribe?utm_medium=crosspromo&utm_source=morning_brew&utm_campaign=daily_moneyscoop_crosspromo_08082021" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">smash this lil’ link to subscribe</a>.</p>

WORK LIFE
</p>

<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Looking for Direction
</h1>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/06/make-work-im-little-lost?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Make It Work logo" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Njg5L21ha2VfaXRfd29ya19sb2dvLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em></em>
</small>
</p>
</a>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Important note:</strong> This section has a new author, as we're reluctantly going to let Kate Noel focus on her day job of running HR at a 120-person media company.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Who could ever fill Kate's Shaq-sized shoes? The one, the only Shane <span class="qu"><span class="gD" data-hovercard-id="sdloughnane120@gmail.com" data-hovercard-owner-id="120">Loughnane.</span></span> A Western Mass. native, Shane's been navigating sticky workplace dilemmas since he was forced to fire his dad from their paper route venture (don't worry, he received a generous severance package). More recently, Shane's held professional roles across a variety of industries, and he'll be an invaluable sounding board for all your workplace challenges. Let's get this party started.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>I don't like my current job but I have no idea what I would rather do instead. Do you have any advice for people like me?—Ashlynn in Denver</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">As Baz Luhrmann (Australian director, writer, producer) <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3FYlPEC8yb4" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">once put it</a>, “Some of the most interesting people I know didn’t know at 22 what they wanted to do with their lives. Some of the most interesting 40-year-olds still don’t.” This is a relevant topic for me, as I’m somewhere between 22 and 40 and honestly haven’t figured it out yet, either. And that’s totally okay.  </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">The first thing you should ask yourself is whether it’s a specific aspect of your current job that you dislike, or if it’s the line of work that you find unfulfilling. If the former, perhaps it’s worth a conversation with your boss: A modification of your current responsibilities, a new role inside the company, or potentially a job switch within the industry would reignite the fire.  </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">If you think you might want to try your hand at something different, start by documenting your non-income generating hobbies and interests—is there a way to monetize any of them? If the answer is, “Maybe, but there are roadblocks,” consider starting small. Even if you can’t up and quit your current job today to pursue it, what would it look like to start something on the side, take a class, or cold email a newsletter editor until they cave and let you write something? </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Still nothing? Pick up a book on something you know nothing about (the Brew has a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">whole shelf full of recs</a>). If it’s not doing it for you, pick up another one. Most people who haven’t found a job that they are passionate about have stopped looking for one. You’re never too far behind, and it’s never too late.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">And don’t forget to wear sunscreen.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">—Shane</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>Something bothering you at work? </em><a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23923023.14227/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B1c068d44?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Ask Shane here</em></a><em>.</em></p>

<tr>
<td width="33%" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt">
<div style="text-align: center; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffe62e 25%, #0f9046); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;">
 
</div>
</td>
<td style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border: 2px solid #353535; background: white; margin: 0px; padding: 10px;">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;word-break: keep-all; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center; text-transform: uppercase; font-family: Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 16px; line-height: 18px; color: #353535; padding: 0px; margin: 0px;">
ANALYSIS
</p>
</td>
<td width="33%" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt">
<div style="text-align: center; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #2b9295, #1c7ff2); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;">
 
</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="">
<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Shein’s All That
</h1>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/06/shein-fastestgrowing-ecommerce-company-youve-maybe-never-heard?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An Instagram post from Addison Rae for Shein" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MTI2L3NoZWluX2FkZGlzb25fcmFlLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em>Instagram</em>
</small>
</p>
</a>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">If you’re not a Gen Z woman with a penchant for online shopping, you may have never heard of the world’s fastest-growing e-commerce company, Shein. If you <em>are</em> in that demographic, the brand likely <a href="https://www.vox.com/the-goods/22573682/shein-future-of-fast-fashion-explained?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">follows you around</a> the internet like an overly attached chihuahua. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">But, unlike a chi, the online fashion retailer has a big bark <em>and</em> a big bite:</p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li aria-level="1"><span>Estimated revenue in 2020 of nearly $10 billion</span></li>
<li aria-level="1"><span>Annual revenue growth of over 100% for eight years running</span></li>
<li aria-level="1"><span>A $15 billion valuation, as of last summer</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Oh, and its app was downloaded more than Amazon on the US App Store in June...nbd.</p>
<h2 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">Now that you’re listening, here’s the background</h2>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Shein is an online-only, fast-fashion retailer based in China, with a focus on women’s apparel. But calling it “fast” is like calling pickle juice delicious: It’s a vast understatement.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">The first wave of fast-fashion retailers (Zara, H&M) <a href="https://www.vox.com/the-goods/2020/2/3/21080364/fast-fashion-h-and-m-zara?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">became popular</a> by creating new designs and getting them to the sales floor in five weeks or less. Fast fashion 2.0, known as “ultra-fast fashion” and popularized by brands like ASOS and Boohoo, got that process down to a week or two. Shein turns around a new design in <strong>as little as three days</strong>.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Fashion Nova made waves back in 2018 when its CEO bragged about launching 600 to 900 styles a week, per Vox. Shein added over 7,000 new styles to its site last Thursday alone (see for yourself <a href="https://us.shein.com/daily-new.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>). The key to its speed is its well-oiled supply chain management.</p>
<h2 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">Shein’s order flow is as frictionless as a Slip ’N Slide covered in soap</h2>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">First, as laid out in Not Boring’s <a href="https://www.notboring.co/p/shein-the-tiktok-of-ecommerce?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">excellent deep dive</a>, Shein analyzes trends and user data to decide which style to churn out next. An in-house design team then sends it to a Shein supplier located in China’s manufacturing hub, Guangzhou.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Here’s where the magic happens: Suppliers start by making a small batch of the product, but once it goes live on Shein.com, real-time shopping data is sent to the factory floor to inform whether to scale production up or down. If the item is being clicked on and added to carts furiously, Shein’s software (which all of its suppliers are required to use) tells the supplier to make more.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">As factory production gears up, Shein.com’s algorithm recommends the product to more shoppers and its marketing team blasts it across social media.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">But moving this fast has resulted in Shein breaking things. Its flywheel sometimes outpaces sound decision-making, meaning products like a “Metal Swastika Pendant Necklace” have ended up on the site.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Looking ahead...</strong>rumors have swirled in China that Shein would IPO sometime in 2021, but that was before Chinese authorities <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/07/china-tightens-regulations-tech-companies?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cracked down</a> on the country’s biggest tech companies, especially when they tried to IPO on US-based exchanges. So we may have to wait a while to learn the juicy financial deets.</p>

Open House
</h1>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Welcome to Open House, the only newsletter section that begs the question, “How exactly am I going to use a screened-in porch in the Texas heat?” We’ll give you a few facts about a listing and you try to guess the price.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><img src="https://media.giphy.com/media/pOj4vw0WCRJIZFDYrE/giphy.gif" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="Front view of house, entryway, screened in porch, staircase, and dining room of house in Tyler, Texas" data-source="Zillow" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Zillow</em> </small></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"> About two hours southeast of Dallas, you’ll find today’s <a href="https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/602-S-Broadway-Ave-Tyler-TX-75701/2129774482_zpid/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">home</a> in the historic district of Tyler, Texas, aka the Rose Capital of the World and home to the largest rose garden in the US (spanning 14 acres and featuring at least 400 varieties of roses.) This 5,091 square-foot home built in 1965 comes with:</p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li aria-level="1"><span>6 beds, 3 baths</span></li>
<li aria-level="1"><span>More arches than you can count on one hand</span></li>
<li aria-level="1"><span>Fancy-shmancy carved ceilings</span></li>
<li aria-level="1"><span>A huge parking lot in the back</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">How much for the Texas palace? Scroll to the bottom of the newsletter to find out.</p>

#353535;\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eGood morning. \u003c/strong\u003eSifting through the replies to yesterday’s newsletter, it became clear that one link in particular resonated with readers: The Atlantic’s \u003ca href=\"https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24674830.0/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cudGhlYXRsYW50aWMuY29tL2ZhbWlseS9hcmNoaXZlLzIwMjEvMDgvd2h5LXdlLXNob3VsZC10YWxrLXN0cmFuZ2Vycy1tb3JlLzYxOTY0Mi8_dXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXc/5f10d6a212c71038741b0759B14e99099?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003earticle\u003c/a\u003e about the benefits of talking with strangers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWhat is it about talking to strangers that intrigues us? Probably because we know it enriches our lives but we can’t bring ourselves to do it.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIf you’re like me, you often freeze when given the opportunity to say hello to your neighbor on a plane. “What if they don’t want to talk to me?” we think. Even worse, what if they \u003cem\u003edo\u003c/em\u003e want to talk to me? Not trying to hear about their stamp collection for three hours. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThese concerns are largely imaginary, and even detrimental. Studies show that chatting with strangers can boost happiness, improve mental health, and make you feel more connected to your community. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eSo, in the spirit of trying something new, I’m suggesting that we all attempt to talk to one stranger today. Then reply and let me know about your experience. Who knows? Maybe you'll meet another Brew reader.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;font-family:flood-std, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-weight:500\"\u003e—Neal Freyman\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE --\u003e\n\u003ctr class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003ctd align=\"left\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MTA5L2VyaWthX3Rob21wc29uLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003eAmanda Jewell Saunders\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIf there are two constants in Erika Thompson’s life, they are: Texas and bees. She started \u003ca href=\"https://texasbeeworks.com/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eTexas Beeworks\u003c/a\u003e in 2014, became a full-time beekeeper in 2019, and signs all her emails with “Bee Well.” But she’s most famous for documenting her calm bee removal services on \u003ca href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@texasbeeworks?lang=en\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eTikTok\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eAfter strapping into a bee suit, we asked Thompson a few Icebreakers—but please, don’t try this at home.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eYou have 9 million followers on TikTok and huge followings on other social platforms. How do you balance creating content with actually being a beekeeper?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI always say creatures before content. I'm so thankful for the ability to show people the important and incredible work that bees and beekeepers do every day. But it can be a challenge. I think a lot of people don't realize that, first and foremost, I'm a beekeeper. And then after many, many other things, I'm putting together social content. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat was the moment when you decided to take beekeeping from a hobby to a career?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eAbout two years ago, I was trying to convince myself and everyone around me that I could leave my good office job and be a full-time beekeeper.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThen, one day I was sitting at work, at my office job, and I opened my email and saw a note from \u003cem\u003eJeopardy!\u003c/em\u003e They were asking me to help create a clue category about bees. And that’s when I thought, “They could have asked anyone.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eJeopardy!\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e category could you win that isn’t bee-related?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eOh my gosh. [Asks husband off call] What do I know a lot about, non-bee related? [Husband responds, “Texas.”]\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat word would best describe you in high school?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eDork. I was in orchestra, I was the captain of my high school bowling team, and I loved \u003cem\u003eStar Wars\u003c/em\u003e. Our school even called the kids in orchestra “Orch Dorks.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eThis interview has been lightly edited and condensed for clarity.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F08%2F06%2Ficebreakers-witherika-thompson-texas-beeworks\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv style=\"font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;\"\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003e\nLooking for Direction\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/06/make-work-im-little-lost?utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"text-decoration:none; border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Make It Work logo\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Njg5L21ha2VfaXRfd29ya19sb2dvLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eImportant note:\u003c/strong\u003e This section has a new author, as we're reluctantly going to let Kate Noel focus on her day job of running HR at a 120-person media company.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWho could ever fill Kate's Shaq-sized shoes? The one, the only Shane \u003cspan class=\"qu\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"gD\" data-hovercard-id=\"sdloughnane120@gmail.com\" data-hovercard-owner-id=\"120\"\u003eLoughnane.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e A Western Mass. native, Shane's been navigating sticky workplace dilemmas since he was forced to fire his dad from their paper route venture (don't worry, he received a generous severance package). More recently, Shane's held professional roles across a variety of industries, and he'll be an invaluable sounding board for all your workplace challenges. Let's get this party started.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eI don't like my current job but I have no idea what I would rather do instead. Do you have any advice for people like me?—Ashlynn in Denver\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eAs Baz Luhrmann (Australian director, writer, producer) \u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3FYlPEC8yb4\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eonce put it\u003c/a\u003e, “Some of the most interesting people I know didn’t know at 22 what they wanted to do with their lives. Some of the most interesting 40-year-olds still don’t.” This is a relevant topic for me, as I’m somewhere between 22 and 40 and honestly haven’t figured it out yet, either. And that’s totally okay.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThe first thing you should ask yourself is whether it’s a specific aspect of your current job that you dislike, or if it’s the line of work that you find unfulfilling. If the former, perhaps it’s worth a conversation with your boss: A modification of your current responsibilities, a new role inside the company, or potentially a job switch within the industry would reignite the fire.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIf you think you might want to try your hand at something different, start by documenting your non-income generating hobbies and interests—is there a way to monetize any of them? If the answer is, “Maybe, but there are roadblocks,” consider starting small. Even if you can’t up and quit your current job today to pursue it, what would it look like to start something on the side, take a class, or cold email a newsletter editor until they cave and let you write something? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eStill nothing? Pick up a book on something you know nothing about (the Brew has a \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewhole shelf full of recs\u003c/a\u003e). If it’s not doing it for you, pick up another one. Most people who haven’t found a job that they are passionate about have stopped looking for one. You’re never too far behind, and it’s never too late.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eAnd don’t forget to wear sunscreen.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e—Shane\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eSomething bothering you at work? \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23923023.14227/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B1c068d44?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eAsk Shane here\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F08%2F06%2Fmake-work-im-little-lost\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv style=\"font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;\"\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003e\nShein’s All That\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/06/shein-fastestgrowing-ecommerce-company-youve-maybe-never-heard?utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"text-decoration:none; border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"An Instagram post from Addison Rae for Shein\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MTI2L3NoZWluX2FkZGlzb25fcmFlLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003eInstagram\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIf you’re not a Gen Z woman with a penchant for online shopping, you may have never heard of the world’s fastest-growing e-commerce company, Shein. If you \u003cem\u003eare\u003c/em\u003e in that demographic, the brand likely \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/the-goods/22573682/shein-future-of-fast-fashion-explained?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efollows you around\u003c/a\u003e the internet like an overly attached chihuahua. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eBut, unlike a chi, the online fashion retailer has a big bark \u003cem\u003eand\u003c/em\u003e a big bite:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"line-height:22px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEstimated revenue in 2020 of nearly $10 billion\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnnual revenue growth of over 100% for eight years running\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA $15 billion valuation, as of last summer\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eOh, and its app was downloaded more than Amazon on the US App Store in June...nbd.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003eNow that you’re listening, here’s the background\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eShein is an online-only, fast-fashion retailer based in China, with a focus on women’s apparel. But calling it “fast” is like calling pickle juice delicious: It’s a vast understatement.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThe first wave of fast-fashion retailers (Zara, H\u0026M) \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/the-goods/2020/2/3/21080364/fast-fashion-h-and-m-zara?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebecame popular\u003c/a\u003e by creating new designs and getting them to the sales floor in five weeks or less. Fast fashion 2.0, known as “ultra-fast fashion” and popularized by brands like ASOS and Boohoo, got that process down to a week or two. Shein turns around a new design in \u003cstrong\u003eas little as three days\u003c/strong\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eFashion Nova made waves back in 2018 when its CEO bragged about launching 600 to 900 styles a week, per Vox. Shein added over 7,000 new styles to its site last Thursday alone (see for yourself \u003ca href=\"https://us.shein.com/daily-new.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehere\u003c/a\u003e). The key to its speed is its well-oiled supply chain management.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003eShein’s order flow is as frictionless as a Slip ’N Slide covered in soap\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eFirst, as laid out in Not Boring’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.notboring.co/p/shein-the-tiktok-of-ecommerce?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexcellent deep dive\u003c/a\u003e, Shein analyzes trends and user data to decide which style to churn out next. An in-house design team then sends it to a Shein supplier located in China’s manufacturing hub, Guangzhou.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eHere’s where the magic happens: Suppliers start by making a small batch of the product, but once it goes live on Shein.com, real-time shopping data is sent to the factory floor to inform whether to scale production up or down. If the item is being clicked on and added to carts furiously, Shein’s software (which all of its suppliers are required to use) tells the supplier to make more.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eAs factory production gears up, Shein.com’s algorithm recommends the product to more shoppers and its marketing team blasts it across social media.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eBut moving this fast has resulted in Shein breaking things. Its flywheel sometimes outpaces sound decision-making, meaning products like a “Metal Swastika Pendant Necklace” have ended up on the site.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003erumors have swirled in China that Shein would IPO sometime in 2021, but that was before Chinese authorities \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/07/china-tightens-regulations-tech-companies?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecracked down\u003c/a\u003e on the country’s biggest tech companies, especially when they tried to IPO on US-based exchanges. So we may have to wait a while to learn the juicy financial deets.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F08%2F06%2Fshein-fastestgrowing-ecommerce-company-youve-maybe-never-heard\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block;
